solution_line_template: If Masud has {masud_siblings} siblings, and Carlos has {carlos_fraction} times as many siblings as Masud, Carlos has {carlos_fraction}*{masud_siblings}=<<{masud_siblings}*{carlos_fraction}={carlos_siblings}>>{carlos_siblings} siblings.
Four times as many siblings as Masud has is {multiplier_four}*{masud_siblings}=<<{multiplier_four}*{masud_siblings}={four_times_masud_siblings}>>{four_times_masud_siblings}

Janet has {janet_less_amount} less than four times as many siblings as Masud, a total of {four_times_masud_siblings}-{janet_less_amount}=<<{four_times_masud_siblings}-{janet_less_amount}={janet_siblings}>>{janet_siblings} siblings.
The number of siblings Janet have more than Carlos is {janet_siblings}-{carlos_siblings}=<<{janet_siblings}-{carlos_siblings}={janet_more_than_carlos}>>{janet_more_than_carlos}
